title: Alibaba Posts Lower Profit Due to Investment Losses, Cuts Revenue Guidance
sub_head: Chinese e-commerce company says profit also hit by higher investments in key strategic areas
body:
Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. said its profit fell for the recent quarter due to losses arising from changes in prices for its investments in publicly traded companies, and it lowered its full-year revenue guidance due to its view on economic conditions and competitive landscape.
The Chinese e-commerce giant on Thursday posted net income attributable to shareholders of 5.37 billion Chinese yuan for the fiscal second quarter, equivalent to $833 million, compared with 28.77 billion yuan in the same period last year. Earnings were 1.97 yuan per American depositary share, compared with 10.48 yuan per American depositary share.
